Psychology:  Apprehension over a New Communications System .A Boffey, P.M. Dissension has arisen in the American Psychological Association (APA) over a multimillion dollar plan to establish a "national information system for psychology."  The plan would supplement the existing psychology journals with a computerized system for distributing unedited manuscripts on a rapid-fire basis. .X 89	1	1293 91	1	1293 105	3	1293 110	2	1293 111	1	1293 113	1	1293 155	1	1293 157	1	1293 161	1	1293 163	1	1293 166	1	1293 243	1	1293 314	1	1293 356	2	1293 429	1	1293 491	1	1293 496	1	1293 513	1	1293 544	1	1293 545	1	1293 560	2	1293 582	3	1293 588	1	1293 589	1	1293 592	2	1293 602	1	1293 603	1	1293 607	1	1293 613	1	1293 614	1	1293 618	1	1293 656	1	1293 657	2	1293 685	2	1293 686	1	1293 690	1	1293 691	1	1293 721	1	1293 722	1	1293 724	1	1293 725	1	1293 958	1	1293 987	1	1293 988	1	1293 1012	1	1293 1030	3	1293 1050	1	1293 1062	2	1293 1208	1	1293 1209	1	1293 1256	1	1293 1284	1	1293 1285	1	1293 1290	1	1293 1291	1	1293 1293	7	1293 1294	1	1293 1295	2	1293 1296	4	1293 1297	1	1293 1298	1	1293 1302	1	1293 1319	1	1293 1346	2	1293 1347	1	1293 1386	1	1293 1386	1	1293
